Package functions

Class PowerFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • functions.FunctionPart
      • functions.PowerFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class PowerFunction
extends FunctionPart
    Klasse, welche eine Potenzfunktion der Form f(x) = a*xp repräsentiert.
    Author:
    Jonathan Brose, Nick Dressler
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • a

        private double a
        Factor a. The result of getFunctionValue(double) is a product of a and base function value.

      • p

        private double p
        Der Exponent p. Der Funktionswert wird mit p potenziert und mit a multipliziert.

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString​(int i,
                                  java.lang.String variablenName)
        Description copied from class: FunctionPart
        Returns the function term as String.
        Specified by:
        getString in class FunctionPart
        Parameters:
        i - :
        • if i > 0 the String starts with "+" or "-" depending on factor a.
          if i=0 only "-" will be added (if a is negative) so if the a is positive nothing will be added in front of the value.
          For example:
          • -4x^2
            if i < 0 the String is like if i > 0, but with a space between.
          For example:
          • - 4x^2 oder + 4x^2
        variablenName -
        • Name of the variable used to calculate the function
          For example:
          • f(vName) = vName^2
        Returns:
        the function term as String.

      • getFractionString

        public java.lang.String[] getFractionString​(int i,
                                            java.lang.String variablenName)

      • getChainingString

        public java.lang.String[] getChainingString​(int i)
        Description copied from class: FunctionPart
        This method is essential for Chaining.getString(int, String). Works almost like FunctionPart.getString(int, String), but it´s split at the variableName and both sides get stored in the array.
        Specified by:
        getChainingString in class FunctionPart
        Parameters:
        i - :
        • if i > 0 the String starts with "+" or "-" depending on factor a.
          if i=0 only "-" will be added (if a is negative) so if the a is positive nothing will be added in front of the value.
          For example:
          • -4x^2
            if i < 0 the String is like if i > 0, but with a space between.
          For example:
          • - 4x^2 oder + 4x^2
        Returns:
        an array with the String left and right from the variable.
        For example:
        • for -2x^3 the method returns ["-2x("; ")^3"]
        Now the inner function String can be inserted between this parts.
        For example:
        • -2x(sin(4))^3
